Title: New Neotropical species of Russula
Abstract:
Russula is a highly diverse ectomycorrhizal genus in the
family Russulaceae. The diversity of the genus is poorly known in
Neotropical countries such as Brazil and Colombia. Twenty one species
have been registered from Brazil and 17 species from Colombia.
Traditional morphological data combined with molecular analysis have
been used to improve the current phylogenetic knowledge of Russula. In
this article we describe three new species from specimens collected in
Brazil and Colombia: Russula insularis, from Southern Brazilian Atlantic
Forest, and R. zafirensis and R. concentrica, from Colombian Amazon rain
forest. Two species are new records for Brazil: Russula
rubropunctatissima and R. violaceotunicata. We present descriptions and
drawings for the new species. Molecular analyses based on nuc
rITS1-5.8-ITS2 (ITS) barcode sequences and the D1-D2 domains of the
large subunit (nuc 28S rDNA) sequences show that R. insularis belong to
section Metachromaticae, R. zafirensis belong to subsection Pluvialis
and R. concentrica belong to subgenus Russula.
